T_RDMI_COMPONENT_CONSTRUCTOR.DESCRIPTION: The OTS_CLIPBOARD component allows USoft C/S applications to interact with the Windows Clipboard. This example has a table component to interact with the Clipboard and show the Clipboard data as records. Additonally there is a set of methods to get and set Clipboard content. (Unicode)Text, FileDrop, Bitmap and WaveAudio support are included. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table can be queried to show what data is on the clipboard. Once this component has been added to the USoft Definer, open the OTS_CLIPBOARD table component in the application, Copy some text, then query all records and see that the copied text appears in the first record. Copy one or more files in the Windows explorer, query all records and see that for each file a record exists with a filepath. Copy an image from e.g. a web page in a browser, query all records and see that a base64 encoded PNG string appears in the first record. To empty the clipboard, delete the record(s) and then commit. To add something to the clipboard, insert a record (or update an existing record), fill the type (UnicodeText, Text, System.String, FileDrop) and fill text in the Data field. Image and Audio data can also be set in the Base64 field but they must be base64 encoded first. Image data must be base64 encoded bytes from a PNG image, Audio data must be Wave format bytes base64 encoded. To see the Clipboard data in SqlCommand: select * from OTS_CLIPBOARD The OTS_CLIPBOARD methods The following methods can be used to directly get or set clipboard data (e.i. not using the table component) Set/Get text: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Puttext('Hello Clipboard') select OTS_CLIPBOARD.gettext() select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getAnsiText() Set/get filepaths: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setFilepaths('c:\temp\file1.txt', 'c:\temp\file2.txt') In this method, one or more filepaths are expected. After this method call, the Windows Clipboard contains the filepaths as FileDrop entries. A paste operation in Windows explorer will copy the files to the paste location if they exist. select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths() This method gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with a ; select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths('myseparator') This method call gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with myseparator select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths(1) This method call gets the DropFile filepath of the first (or nth, depending on the positive integer value passed) filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage() Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImageSrc(5) Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded JPG, compressed by the compression number, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath') Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( '' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality), stores the jpg in filepath select ots_clipboard.Image2JPG('infilepath', 'outfilepath', compression) This method is a utility to convert an image in infilepath to jpg format into outfilepath, compressed by compression (integer ranging from 1-100) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setImage('filepath') This method sets the image in filepath on the Clipboard select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimageSrc() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage('filepath') Gets the image on the Clipboard PNG stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.SetAudio('filepath') puts an audio stream on the Clipboard from the wav format audio file in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Clear() This method clears the Windows Clipboard. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component, SqlCommand examples. Update an existin entry example: Update OTS_CLIPBOARD set TYPEVALUE = 'UnicodeText' , DATAVALUE = 'Hello Clipboard' Where keyvalue = 1 (Note that when you copy e.g. the above to SqlCommand, your Clipboard contains that text. Thus, if you executed Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD of select OTS_CLIPBOAR.Clear() just befire, the Windows Clipboard is not empty anymore) Delete all from the Windows Clipboard: Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD Insert the USoft logo on the Windows Clipboard: insert into OTS_CLIPBOARD (KEYVALUE, TYPEVALUE, DATAVALUE, BASE64VALUE) Values ( 1, 'Bitmap', '', to_clob('') )

T_RDMI_COMPONENT.DESCRIPTION: The OTS_CLIPBOARD component allows USoft C/S applications to interact with the Windows Clipboard. This example has a table component to interact with the Clipboard and show the Clipboard data as records. Additonally there is a set of methods to get and set Clipboard content. (Unicode)Text, FileDrop, Bitmap and WaveAudio support are included. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table can be queried to show what data is on the clipboard. Once this component has been added to the USoft Definer, open the OTS_CLIPBOARD table component in the application, Copy some text, then query all records and see that the copied text appears in the first record. Copy one or more files in the Windows explorer, query all records and see that for each file a record exists with a filepath. Copy an image from e.g. a web page in a browser, query all records and see that a base64 encoded PNG string appears in the first record. To empty the clipboard, delete the record(s) and then commit. To add something to the clipboard, insert a record (or update an existing record), fill the type (UnicodeText, Text, System.String, FileDrop) and fill text in the Data field. Image and Audio data can also be set in the Base64 field but they must be base64 encoded first. Image data must be base64 encoded bytes from a PNG image, Audio data must be Wave format bytes base64 encoded. To see the Clipboard data in SqlCommand: select * from OTS_CLIPBOARD The OTS_CLIPBOARD methods The following methods can be used to directly get or set clipboard data (e.i. not using the table component) Set/Get text: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Puttext('Hello Clipboard') select OTS_CLIPBOARD.gettext() select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getAnsiText() Set/get filepaths: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setFilepaths('c:\temp\file1.txt', 'c:\temp\file2.txt') In this method, one or more filepaths are expected. After this method call, the Windows Clipboard contains the filepaths as FileDrop entries. A paste operation in Windows explorer will copy the files to the paste location if they exist. select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths() This method gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with a ; select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths('myseparator') This method call gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with myseparator select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths(1) This method call gets the DropFile filepath of the first (or nth, depending on the positive integer value passed) filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage() Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImageSrc(5) Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded JPG, compressed by the compression number, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath') Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( '' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality), stores the jpg in filepath select ots_clipboard.Image2JPG('infilepath', 'outfilepath', compression) This method is a utility to convert an image in infilepath to jpg format into outfilepath, compressed by compression (integer ranging from 1-100) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setImage('filepath') This method sets the image in filepath on the Clipboard select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimageSrc() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage('filepath') Gets the image on the Clipboard PNG stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.SetAudio('filepath') puts an audio stream on the Clipboard from the wav format audio file in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Clear() This method clears the Windows Clipboard. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component, SqlCommand examples. Update an existin entry example: Update OTS_CLIPBOARD set TYPEVALUE = 'UnicodeText' , DATAVALUE = 'Hello Clipboard' Where keyvalue = 1 (Note that when you copy e.g. the above to SqlCommand, your Clipboard contains that text. Thus, if you executed Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD of select OTS_CLIPBOAR.Clear() just befire, the Windows Clipboard is not empty anymore) Delete all from the Windows Clipboard: Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD Insert the USoft logo on the Windows Clipboard: insert into OTS_CLIPBOARD (KEYVALUE, TYPEVALUE, DATAVALUE, BASE64VALUE) Values ( 1, 'Bitmap', '', to_clob('') )

This example has a table component to interact with the Clipboard and show the Clipboard data as records. Additonally there is a set of methods to get and set Clipboard content. (Unicode)Text, FileDrop, Bitmap and WaveAudio support are included. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table can be queried to show what data is on the clipboard. Once this component has been added to the USoft Definer, open the OTS_CLIPBOARD table component in the application, Copy some text, then query all records and see that the copied text appears in the first record. Copy one or more files in the Windows explorer, query all records and see that for each file a record exists with a filepath. Copy an image from e.g. a web page in a browser, query all records and see that a base64 encoded PNG string appears in the first record. To empty the clipboard, delete the record(s) and then commit. To add something to the clipboard, insert a record (or update an existing record), fill the type (UnicodeText, Text, System.String, FileDrop) and fill text in the Data field. Image and Audio data can also be set in the Base64 field but they must be base64 encoded first. Image data must be base64 encoded bytes from a PNG image, Audio data must be Wave format bytes base64 encoded. To see the Clipboard data in SqlCommand: select * from OTS_CLIPBOARD The OTS_CLIPBOARD methods The following methods can be used to directly get or set clipboard data (e.i. not using the table component) Set/Get text: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Puttext('Hello Clipboard') select OTS_CLIPBOARD.gettext() select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getAnsiText() Set/get filepaths: select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setFilepaths('c:\temp\file1.txt', 'c:\temp\file2.txt') In this method, one or more filepaths are expected. After this method call, the Windows Clipboard contains the filepaths as FileDrop entries. A paste operation in Windows explorer will copy the files to the paste location if they exist. select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths() This method gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with a ; select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths('myseparator') This method call gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with myseparator select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths(1) This method call gets the DropFile filepath of the first (or nth, depending on the positive integer value passed) filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage() Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImageSrc(5) Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded JPG, compressed by the compression number, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath') Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( '' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality), stores the jpg in filepath select ots_clipboard.Image2JPG('infilepath', 'outfilepath', compression) This method is a utility to convert an image in infilepath to jpg format into outfilepath, compressed by compression (integer ranging from 1-100) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setImage('filepath') This method sets the image in filepath on the Clipboard select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimageSrc() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage('filepath') Gets the image on the Clipboard PNG stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.SetAudio('filepath') puts an audio stream on the Clipboard from the wav format audio file in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Clear() This method clears the Windows Clipboard. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component, SqlCommand examples. Update an existin entry example: Update OTS_CLIPBOARD set TYPEVALUE = 'UnicodeText' , DATAVALUE = 'Hello Clipboard' Where keyvalue = 1 (Note that when you copy e.g. the above to SqlCommand, your Clipboard contains that text. Thus, if you executed Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD of select OTS_CLIPBOAR.Clear() just befire, the Windows Clipboard is not empty anymore) Delete all from the Windows Clipboard: Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD Insert the USoft logo on the Windows Clipboard: insert into OTS_CLIPBOARD (KEYVALUE, TYPEVALUE, DATAVALUE, BASE64VALUE) Values ( 1, 'Bitmap', '', to_clob('') )

T_RDMI_STATEFUL_COMPONENT.DESCRIPTION: The OTS_CLIPBOARD component allows USoft C/S applications to interact with the Windows Clipboard. This example has a table component to interact with the Clipboard and show the Clipboard data as records. Additonally there is a set of methods to get and set Clipboard content. Once this component has been added to the USoft Definer, open the OTS_CLIPBOARD table component in the application, Copy some text, then query all records and see that the copied text appears in the first record. Copy one or more files in the Windows explorer, query all records and see that for each file a record exists with a filepath. Copy an image from e.g. a web page in a browser, query all records and see that a base64 encoded PNG string appears in the first record. To empty the clipboard, delete the record(s) and then commit. To add something to the clipboard, insert a record (or update an existing record), fill the type (UnicodeText, Text, System.String, FileDrop) and fill text in the Data field. Image and Audio data can also be set in the Base64 field but they must be base64 encoded first. A paste operation in Windows explorer will copy the files to the paste location if they exist. select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths() This method gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with a ; select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths('myseparator') This method call gets the DropFile filepaths from the Windows Clipboard, separated with myseparator select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getfilepaths(1) This method call gets the DropFile filepath of the first (or nth, depending on the positive integer value passed) filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage() Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImageSrc(5) Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded JPG, compressed by the compression number, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath') Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( '' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as base64 encoded jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getJPGImage( 'filepath' , 5) Gets the image on the Windows Clipboard as jpg image, compres value 5 (lower values is higer compression, lower quality), stores the jpg in filepath select ots_clipboard.Image2JPG('infilepath', 'outfilepath', compression) This method is a utility to convert an image in infilepath to jpg format into outfilepath, compressed by compression (integer ranging from 1-100) select OTS_CLIPBOARD.setImage('filepath') This method sets the image in filepath on the Clipboard select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimageSrc() Gets the image on the Clipboard as base64 encoded PNG, ready to use as value for the src attribute in an html element select OTS_CLIPBOARD.getpPNGimage('filepath') Gets the image on the Clipboard PNG stored in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.SetAudio('filepath') puts an audio stream on the Clipboard from the wav format audio file in filepath select OTS_CLIPBOARD.Clear() This method clears the Windows Clipboard. The OTS_CLIPBOARD table component, SqlCommand examples. Update an existin entry example: Update OTS_CLIPBOARD set TYPEVALUE = 'UnicodeText' , DATAVALUE = 'Hello Clipboard' Where keyvalue = 1 (Note that when you copy e.g. the above to SqlCommand, your Clipboard contains that text. Thus, if you executed Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD of select OTS_CLIPBOAR.Clear() just befire, the Windows Clipboard is not empty anymore) Delete all from the Windows Clipboard: Delete from OTS_CLIPBOARD Insert the USoft logo on the Windows Clipboard: insert into OTS_CLIPBOARD (KEYVALUE, TYPEVALUE, DATAVALUE, BASE64VALUE) Values ( 1, 'Bitmap', '', to_clob('') )
